com.here.android.mpa.ftcr

Class FTCRNavigationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.ftcr.FTCRNavigationManager

  • public final class FTCRNavigationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A navigation manager class that provides guidance advice and information along the FTCR routes.

    IMPORTANT: FTCRNavigationManager is a Beta feature. The related classes are subject to change without notice.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FTCRNavigationManager.FTCRNavigationManagerListener
      An interface for responding to navigation events sent by the FTCRNavigationManager.
      static class  FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingMode
      The mode that is used when map tracking is enabled.
      static class  FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingTilt
      The tilt that is used when map tracking is enabled.

      Use the public constructor to create FTCRNavigationManager.

    • Method Detail

      • setMap

        public void setMap(Map map)
        Set Map to this Navigation Manager object and show the Navigation on Map. Passing null will remove Navigation from the Map.
        Parameters:
        map - The Map to show the Navigation on.
        See Also:
        FTCRNavigationManager.setMapTrackingMode(TrackingMode), FTCRNavigationManager.setMapTrackingTilt(TrackingTilt)

      • setMapTrackingTilt

        public void setMapTrackingTilt(FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingTilt value)
        Controls how the map is tilted when map tracking is enabled. Default value is FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingTilt.TILT3D

        In 2D and 3D modes, the map will automatically be tilted back appropriately when the tilt value is changed. In Custom mode, the tilt will not be changed. Use custom mode to allow the map to be manually tilted during navigation or to set the tilt to a fixed custom value.

        Parameters:
        value - FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingTilt value to define how the map is tilted when map tracking is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if map is not set for this navigation manager.
        See Also:
        FTCRNavigationManager.setMap(Map)

      • getMapTrackingTilt

        public FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingTilt getMapTrackingTilt()
        Returns how the map is tilted when map tracking is enabled.
        Returns:
        How the map is tilted when map tracking is enabled.
        See Also:
        FTCRNavigationManager.setMap(Map)

      • setMapTrackingMode

        public void setMapTrackingMode(FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingMode value)
        Controls how the map is moved and rotated when map tracking is enabled. Default value is FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingMode.FOLLOW
        Parameters:
        value - FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingMode value to define how the map is moved when map tracking is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if map is not set for this navigation manager.
        See Also:
        FTCRNavigationManager.setMap(Map)

      • getMapTrackingMode

        public FTCRNavigationManager.TrackingMode getMapTrackingMode()
        Returns map tracking mode.
        Returns:
        How the map is moved and rotated when map tracking is enabled.
        See Also:
        FTCRNavigationManager.setMap(Map)

      • simulate

        public void simulate(FTCRRoute route,
                     int speed)
        Starts turn-by-turn simulation.
        Parameters:
        route - The route used to navigate.
        speed - The speed for simulation in m/s.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if route is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if speed <= 0.

      • start

        public void start(FTCRRoute route)
        Start turn-by-turn navigation.

        Note, in case of reroute, old FTCRMapRoute should be removed from the map and new mapRoute added to the map.

        Parameters:
        route - The route used to navigate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if route is null.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops turn-by-turn navigation.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Gets whether navigation is currently active.
        Returns:
        True whether navigation is currently active.

      • addNavigationListener

        public void addNavigationListener(FTCRNavigationManager.FTCRNavigationManagerListener listener)
        Add navigation manager listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

      • removeNavigationListener

        public void removeNavigationListener(FTCRNavigationManager.FTCRNavigationManagerListener listener)
        Removes navigation manager listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.

      • getCurrentManeuver

        public FTCRRoute.FTCRManeuver getCurrentManeuver()

        Returns:
        The next maneuver.

        public FTCRRoute.FTCRManeuver getNextManeuver()
        Return next maneuver or null if there is no such a maneuver.
        Returns:
        The next maneuver.

      • getDistanceToCurrentManeuver

        public long getDistanceToCurrentManeuver()
        Return distance in meters to the current maneuver. If current maneuver is null, then Long.MAX_VALUE is returned.
        Returns:
        distance in meters to the current maneuver.

      • getDistanceToNextManeuver

        public long getDistanceToNextManeuver()
        Return distance in meters to the next maneuver. If next maneuver is null, then Long.MAX_VALUE is returned.
        Returns:
        distance in meters to the next maneuver.

      • getAverageSpeed

        public float getAverageSpeed()
        Returns average speed in meters per seconds for the current active navigation session.
        Returns:
        The average speed.

      • getTravelledDistance

        public long getTravelledDistance()
        Returns travelled distance in meters for the current active navigation session.
        Returns:
        The travelled distance.

      • getRemainingDistance

        public long getRemainingDistance(int subleg)
        Returns the remaining distance in meters to the end of the specified leg of the route.
        Parameters:
        subleg - The subleg number to use or FTCRRoute.WHOLE_ROUTE for the whole route.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters. Returns Long.MAX_VALUE if an error occurred or if the end of given route leg has been already reached.

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime(int subleg)
        Returns the remaining time in seconds to the end of the specified leg of the route.
        Parameters:
        subleg - The subleg number to use or FTCRRoute.WHOLE_ROUTE for the whole route.
        Returns:
        The time in seconds. Returns Long.MAX_VALUE if an error occurred or if the end of given route leg has been already reached.

      • getRoutePosition

        public GeoPosition getRoutePosition()
        Returns matched route position for current navigation session, can be null if current gps position can not be matched.
        Returns:
        Matched route position or null if current gps position can not be matched.
